title: OVERPROMPT templates have hardcoded paths instead of variables
description: The OVERPROMPT-standard.md and OVERPROMPT-gitops.md templates contain hardcoded paths to '/home/becker/projects/triager' instead of using {{PROJECT_PATH}} variables. When init-project.sh copies these templates, it doesn't perform variable substitution like it does for README.md, resulting in all new projects having incorrect paths pointing to 'triager'.
steps_to_reproduce: Search for project paths in Phase 1, 2, 3, 4, 5, 6 prompts
Observe: All paths reference /home/becker/projects/triager instead of /tmp/test
expected_behavior: OVERPROMPT.md should contain paths specific to the project where it was initialized. For example, if initialized at /home/user/projects/myapp/feature-management, all paths should reference /home/user/projects/myapp.
actual_behavior: OVERPROMPT.md contains hardcoded paths to /home/becker/projects/triager regardless of where the project is initialized.

evidence.template_line_27: prompt: Scan the feature-management repository at /home/becker/projects/triager/feature-management
evidence.init_script_line_78: cp OVERPROMPT-${PROJECT_TYPE}.md â†’ OVERPROMPT.md (no sed replacement)
evidence.comparison_readme: README.md uses {{PROJECT_NAME}} variables and gets sed replacement (lines 84-86)

root_cause: Templates were created with specific project paths for testing/example purposes. The init-project.sh script was never updated to perform variable substitution on OVERPROMPT.md like it does for README.md.
impact: All new projects initialized with init-project.sh will have broken subagent paths and incorrect feature-management paths in their OVERPROMPT.md. Users must manually edit 7+ locations to fix paths, which is error-prone and defeats the purpose of the init script.
